title: Virgin Orbit reduces launch forecast while increasing per-launch revenue
summary: Virgin Orbit now expects to perform four launches this year, at the low end of earlier projections, but with a higher per-launch revenue.

title: U.S. Army hands over satellite operations to Space Force, but keeps a foothold in space
summary: Satellite ground stations that for decades have been operated by the U.S. Army will be officially handed over to the Space Force on Aug. 15.

title: NASA, Space Force resolve SLS flight termination system issue
summary: NASA and the U.S. Space Force have resolved an issue with the flight termination system on the Space Launch System that could have cut short the vehicle’s inaugural launch campaign.

title: Harris says U.S. to update commercial space regulations
summary: Vice President Kamala Harris said Aug. 12 that the National Space Council will work to revise commercial space regulations that have become “simply outdated” as the industry evolves.

title: SpaceX preps 46 more Starlink satellites for launch into polar orbit
summary: SpaceX plans to launch a Falcon 9 rocket with 46 Starlink internet satellites into polar orbit Friday from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, continuing deployment of the company’s commercial broadband network.

title: Anuvu buys Signal Mountain Networks to expand government business
summary: Mobile satellite connectivity specialist Anuvu is looking for more avenues for growth with the acquisition of Signal Mountain Networks, a satellite communications provider to the U.S. government.

title: Intelsat and OneWeb to provide multi-orbit inflight connectivity
summary: Intelsat said Aug. 11 it has signed a global distribution deal with OneWeb to provide multi-orbit inflight connectivity solutions for airlines.

title: SpaceX continues Starlink expansion with third launch to shell 3
summary: SpaceX launched the Starlink Group 3-3 mission on Friday, marking the company’s 55th dedicated launch to build its satellite internet constellation. Group 3-3 took flight on a flight-proven Falcon 9 rocket from Space Launch Complex 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base in California, with a one-second launch window at 2:40 pm PDT (21:40 UTC).

title: Rocket Report: SpaceX sees rideshare demand, Russia’s odd launch deal with Iran
summary: "One of the questions that we’re getting a lot is, 'How full are you guys?'"

title: SpaceX set to launch third batch of sun-synchronous Starlink satellites
summary: SpaceX says it’s on track to launch a third batch of operational Starlink satellites to sun-synchronous orbit (SSO) as early as 2:40...
